de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking

Interface NetworkDataSink

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsoluteFilter, AbstractFilter, AccelerationPhaseDetection, AveragingFilter, ClientConnection, ClientSplitter, DataMapper, DataMapper.SinkOriginFilter, DifferenceThresholdFilter, IntegratingFilter, JointControl, MarbleLabyrinthControl, MinimumAmplitudeChangeFilter, MouseMover, PipelineDuplication, ScalingFilter, SensorSplitter, SteeringWheel, Switch, TemporaryIntegratingFilter, ThresholdingFilter, ThroughputMeasurer, UserSensitivityMultiplicator

    public interface NetworkDataSink
    This interface is used when you want to define a data splitter, or an end piece of the data pipeline that consumes the incoming data. It may also be implemented in combination with NetworkDataSource, like in AbstractFilter, to create a class that does not use but modify the data.

    On the app side, the origin and the sensor sensitivity of data are not relevant, so DataSink is used there.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      called when the sink is no longer used and should no longer require resources
      void onData(NetworkDevice origin, SensorData data, float userSensitivity)
      onData is called whenever new data is to be processed

    • Method Detail

      • onData

        void onData(NetworkDevice origin,
            SensorData data,
            float userSensitivity)
        onData is called whenever new data is to be processed
        Parameters:
        origin - the network device which sent the data
        data - the sensor data
        userSensitivity - the sensitivity the user requested in his app settings for the sensor the data is from

      • close

        void close()
        called when the sink is no longer used and should no longer require resources
